instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Hi guys

Got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> here that has a backlight issue. No sign of any liquid damage on the board, all seems clean.

The screen has a display, but the backlight is intermittent. By that I mean that sometimes it will boot normally, screen will light, all is good.

Sometimes however it won't light up, it has a display but no backlight.

If I close the lid, the screen turns off as usual, opening it again results in no backlight most of the time.

Is there any point I should be starting to look at first?

<SIGNAL>PPV_OUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> (measured at Pin1 of LVDS connector) is 38v when functioning but reads at 11.5v when backlight is off.

I dimly recall something about <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and the hall sensor - is that a common area I should look at?

Many thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Can't delete my post so I'll update - there IS liquid damage, didn't see the tiny spot of corrosion right underneath the backlight controller, will sort that and post back if there's still a problem!

Cheers!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A intermittent backlight
threads.message:
If cleaning board doesn't help, be sure to use original charger.
MagSafe 1 to 2 adapter can cause that...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A intermittent backlight
threads.message:
Cleaning the board (removed the <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> IC and cleaned / resoldered), and the backlight driver, all seems well now with an instant backlight response rather than the delayed response I was getting before.

However, wasn't aware of the Magsafe 1->2 adapter issue - will lodge that in the memory bank!!

Many thanks
